cGHijxo8Qw-soROjT6KRGQ.text: I've always celebrated my birthday at Texas Roadhouse and today was the last time I will ever do that, the stake was a little above average, the waitress was good and the assistant manager was rude and disrespectful, she came over sat at our table and before we finish our meal told us that we had to finish our food quick and the friend arriving late was not going to be able to eat with us because she had a large party to seat at our place "party pooper". I was in disbelief that we were given such a nasty message.  I deem that is the trend at this place and instead of tables they should set up narrow counters along the walls so that you ca chug the food down to make space for the next one.  Poor company training and policy.

iniBh5OejFTO9Kgk1tBT8A.text: I just want to start by saying we loooooove Texas Roadhouse at my house. This time was very different. We ordered and got a really pleasant server (Jack) we waited patiently for our food. They brought our food and messed up 3 times.. put in the wrong item. And on top of that the manager was apologetic but she wasn't even empathetic. They still missed the fries we ordered. The 3 times they fixed our order they could have brought the steak fries. Overall it was a bad experience.

cXAo7Hty-OdEBgB_GNTajA.text: Great food and great service. We've been coming here about twice a month for years and never had an issue.

DEPyCz3wYbWlS1AWW5BPRg.text: Family birthday dinner 12. of us   We had drinks and fresh hot bread while we were waiting for our table.  Our waitress was so sweet and was able to handle my large family.   They sang Happy Birthday to our family member  I did think wS steak was over cooked but everyone else meal was great   I will be back for the next celebration dinner

SIqazk9c4RKz-QNMSLKPzw.text: We always come here for the bread baskets and cinnamon butter. Salads are good, steaks sometimes get overcooked. The potato skin appetizers are awesome! Ribs are either hit or miss. I usually come here every once in awhile.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Tempe, AZ, United States

aYjUHM8XAoFR3tzR7JEvIw.text: Wonderful experience at Texas Roadhouse with friends tonight! Our server Melissa was friendly and attentive, and everything was cooked as ordered and even though it was busy we got everything very fast. Highly recommend

azMtEm7PXW6697ixTzHvMQ.text: Omg I will never go to this location ever. We arrived at about 930p on Friday night. It took about 30 mins or more for our food to come out. When it came out, it was cold steak. The chicken was dry and covered in BBQ sauce. The baked potato was under cooked and the butter, cheese, and sour cream didn't melt. We asked for a manage it took him forever to come out. Then he said they turned off the equipment to heat the food. He gave us coupons, but then brought us the bill and charged us full price for food we didn't eat. Finally, another manager came out out took the food off of the bill. The process was over 30 plus mins.

abZj43VQKZhCU81FelobxQ.text: Let me start by saying we have eaten at countless Texas Roadhouse restaurants. This place is in a convenient location and just opened 3 months ago. It is obvious that the place just is not used to handling crowds and is still trying to learn to be a restaurant. Had to constantly ask staff for beverage refills ... My pet peeve. After almost 40 minutes our server arrived with our order .. One short, telling us they ran out of chicken. They just realized that when they went to deliver the order. The manager, Hilson, came out apologized, took a replacement order and delivered that swiftly.  They were quick to assume responsibility for the situation, comped the person for the inconvenience and gave them a voucher for another free new. What we did order was good. Will give them one more try. Too many other steak restaurants in the area where I know I can get a good meal and good service.

by46Fnb4Wg67S51CabDyfw.text: I love this place. I keep coming back. Steaks are fabulous and their ribs truly do fall off the bone. They are really good. I especially love their rolls..

pGny5zCsIHW041B4RrXnfg.text: They said 15-25 minutes for wait and it was on point. The nuts and rolls are to die for, per usual. Friendly and upbeat server. The kids were given an upgraded drink with lids, perfect. Oh and when one decided to throw a tantrum during ordering, the server was calm and didn't skip a beat. Salads came out promptly and were tasty. The steaks and kids meal then took about a half hour to arrive. The manager apologized as did our server. Honestly, wasn't that long but kids were restless. Food came, it was consistent Texas Roadhouse and we were satisfied. The manager didn't give us a discount but actually gave us the entire bill for free. I'm shocked because we didn't ask for anything and he was generous and just a real pleasure. That act is something that will keep me returning to this restaurant, time and time again. Kudos TR, I'm forever a fan.

QlnccQUtZkbfKWociV8m_A.text: I Have visited this location about 3xs since open and out of all the locations (which I have tried) this one has the best customer service. I love the Happy Hour prices. The food is amazing. I tried the shredded pork for the first time every and it was amazing. Of course everyone need to get the onion blossom. It's one of the best I have tried. Great job on adding this location. I don't have to travel 30mins anymore to others locations. I might add I will probably become a regular here.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Tempe, AZ, United States. Combo meal half slab ribs/pulled pork 15.99 and worth is. Onion blossom 4.99 and all you can eat biscuits...heaven!

K9gzxDH3M31rLhKein1kkA.text: No thank you. It is a generous offer but I decline because I have no desire to return.

MI88Ztqwue5CLX2M09TMaA.text: High energy, excellent food, excellent service, excellent management team.  You could even say it's legendary!!  Love the new building too!

XyWX4CXqjGPQ24vwe6WMQA.text: Been here a few times with my wife and have never been disappointed. Service with a smile and excellent food to go with it. Always order the sirloin steak cooked medium and it's always perfect. The atmosphere is always fun and casual, of which I thoroughly enjoy because I don't like to dress up for dinner unless I have to. For the money, there's not a better place for steak!

bwXARNGHM2BLKsPobegyBw.text: Service was great, as always.  We were kept fully stocked with those famous rolls and our food came in a timely manner. The abundance of peanut shells near the entrance threw me off a bit as walking through them in sandals isn't the most appealing thing walking into a restaurant. Great location; not many restaurants in the area so it's nice to have some options.

OzbRUXFIK22qTtjCSUvhvQ.text: Visited for the first time yesterday for Sunday dinner. I had been to the Mesa location and enjoyed it and this one is closer to my house.  My daughter and I got the half rack ribs. Mine was so burnt it tasted like a charcoal briquette smothered in bottled barbecue sauce.  The mashed potatoes were congealed Into the shape of a splat where the cook had slopped a spoonful into the dish. I took a bite and got a mouthful of half a raw potato.  My daughter was too mortified to complain about hers (she's 15). Her baked potato was good. We paid an extra dollar for it to be 'loaded' which meant a handful of shredded cheese and some bacon bits.  Even the famous bread tasted like stale reheated King's Hawaiian rolls.   My husband liked his chicken fried steak, he got 'loaded' steak fries, which again was a hand full of shredded cheese all in one spot with some bacon bits. The side salads were the best thing there. Then they still charged me for my dinner until we asked to have it removed and only pay for the salad. (I had returned it after one bite) The manager never came by. So if you like Texas Roadhouse, do yourself a favor and drive to Stapley. Although there is usually a wait, now I know why this location didn't have a wait.

8LkY0GZEkIgnEB-_zfRMBQ.text: 12/28/16 I placed a to go order.  Once I got home I realize I didn't have all of it.  After eating what I did receive I also had food poisoning until 2 a.m.  I don't think I'll be eating there again ever.

0JTNbPdWfiE_n933i4FyAw.text: I love Texas Roadhouse! The food is so good and stuffing. If it is your birthday you get to sit on a saddle and you get free dessert. The only bad part is the wait  and it's about 10-30 minutes. You get peanuts and fresh baked bread while you wait for  your drinks and food to come.

fhcydPRtOuNK0LAPqbq2Xg.text: The staff is nice, but the food not so much.  I asked for a rare steak and got a medium.  I sent it back and the steak they replaced it with was between medium-rare and medium.  The first steak actually looked nice and seared, the second steak had no sear at all.  It looked like something I'd get at Denny's for 10 bucks.  Severely unimpressive for a $26 steak.

qhl0i5fMB9Jh9qwfpl6AiQ.text: Five stars all around literally get Fridays once a week little pricey but that's the only issue I have with them thank you Freddy's for becoming my new addiction Cali burger for life!!

8ZsIchwywJ4CnUGLQ8fF5g.text: Service was good. Really nice people food was about a B- only problem I had was my mash potatoes were cold but if you haven't tried Texas Roadhouse you should !

c1v6c_8aTnFui_y3po6ivg.text: So happy to have a Texas Roadhouse in Tempe. Ordered the country fried steak with a side of rice and baked potato to go. The crew was very welcoming and had such a great attitude even threw in some extra rolls for me. I will def be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Tempe, AZ, United States. Country fried steak, rice, bake potato to go

ish1XfkJR-TQNp9bvAW7Jw.text: This place is great! You get lots of excellent food for your money and the staff is awesome. Our last waitress, Jessie, was fantastic! Our drinks were never empty and our table was always clear of plates we didn't need anymore. She was very knowledgeable about the food, made great recommendations and was super sweet. 5/5!

F1bxHSU7lqjkIRiJt6B2MA.text: Great service! I was concerned when I saw the first reviews. ..but I'm so glad I didn't listen. This a fun place with happy friendly servers. Our food was prepared exactly as we asked. Everything tasted great. We had Kiersten  as our server and she was awesome. She was personable and she made sure we had everything we needed. Be smart we have the app on our phone and call ahead seating. This is a popular place and brand new so it's  going to be packed.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Tempe, AZ, United States. Awesome new lemonade. .Blue Crush and Wild Raspberry!

P-fGrt4W1qAk-u1OzWOJaA.text: All the steak type places are pretty much the same.  I have the smothered chicken with sweet potato.  I enjoyed the meal since it was quick and filling.  I normally try to avoid chains but again it wasn't terrible.  Service was good.

YoQhfDou0Kq2Sd1UQVOuGg.text: Bad location! We usually go to the Metro Center store but we decided to-go to the Tempe store. We were celebrating my husbands b-day. Did a call ahead just for our party to get there and had to wait 25 mins just to get two booths in the back, back to back. how can we celebrate a b-day  while sitting separate!? The food took for ever to come out and never got the drinks. Some of us never got food! Some of the food was wrong...Then the server was stressed out or annoyed or something. Idk if she was stressed out with us or that it was a busy Friday night but it defiantly rubbed off on us and made us feel like we were the prob. I feel like she knows its a busy restaurant deal with it or dont  Asked to speak with a manager witched never showed. Idk if the server did not send for them or they just dint care enough to come see how our experience was. Will not be going to this location again..

Zg7exbn5bNjMVTlm2EeWAQ.text: As a regular customer at the Texas Roadhouse establishments, I was not pleased with the service that I received this evening. We happily came to celebrate my sisters 18th birthday, but our night was ruined by a balding, 25 year old male, who looked like Francis from Pee-wee's Big Adventure (not an exaggeration). He threw napkins and straws at us if it was hay and we were a herd of cattle being fed for the day and when we kindly complained to the service manager, she said, "I'll do the best I can to fix his mistakes, and will give y'all a different waiter". When we told "Francis" (real name Chop, I know right?) he was not our waiter anymore, he shouted out in glee, "yay! that is AWESOME!!!!". We were sat at a booth that did not fit my party, so a chair was added to the end of the table. This gave an opportunity for the vulgar waiter and his friends to rudely bump into my aunt, and slightly spill water on her. This made us to take it up to James, the general manager, and he told us, "do you want to stay here, or want me to throw you out. I have the best servers in the world, and if I saw anyone of them do that, they would be FIRED on the spot". We told him we'll just enjoy the bread and cinnamon butter, with his red, flustered, sweaty face that gave the look of disgust and walked away. If my sister was not craving a 20 oz prime rib (which they did not have) we would have left, but we stayed because she also wanted a steak. Jordan, a nice girl, who looks like she is going to gain a pharmacy degree and a 4.0 GPA was then assigned as our waitress. Not once did she hesitate with our request, if James would show leadership, I would have gave 5 stars just for Jordan! when it came time to say the famous "YEEEHAAAW" for birthday guest, Jordan was the ONLY one who came and announced the birthday. I have the snapchats to prove it. Jordan was the only server who met our needs and went above and beyond with everything she did. Jordan exudes success and she should be promoted.

-E2FKeNlvHS3dhkex7A-_A.text: Came to this location last night for dinner. It was my first time ever coming to a Texas Roadhouse and will certainly not be my last. Right from the start the service was amazing. Hostess was very friendly and polite. Took the liberty of telling me her favorite dishes and recommendations   since I had never been a Texas Roadhouse before. Our server, Jett was flawless in every way. Very polite and friendly and always super fast as well as attentive, even though it was peak dinner time and he had a full section. The food was spectacular. Had the cactus onion as an appetizer and the country fried sirloin with loaded mashed potatoes and green beans as my entree. I've worked in restaurants for five years and now manage an establishment and can say in my professional opinion this restaurant is run to 100% quality from the staff to the food and drinks. It was an amazing experience and will definitely be back very very soon. Most credit going to Jett. Management should feel as lucky to have him on their staff as I was to have him as a server.

dZw1PegQt_YrakomrzoYGg.text: We hadn't been to Texas Roadhouse in years and we decided to use a gift card we received for Christmas to have dinner here the evening before Mother's Day. Wow, what a great experience! Our wait of 25 minutes wasn't bad at all, considering we had no reservation & it was Mother's Day weekend, and we ended up having a wonderful dining experience. Our server, Anne, was awesome - so friendly and attentive - and our meals were absolutely delicious. My husband's steak was perfectly prepared, as was my grilled shrimp. Given the quality of the food and service at this location (especially on such a busy weekend), it is obvious they have a great manager (who actually visited our table) who keeps his employees' morale high. We'll definitely be back soon!

7Vz-mm3OMpxaBKIkfNx8lg.text: I usually don't write negative reviews, but I'd be doing everyone a disservice if I didn't share my experience here:  ONE AND HALF HOURS from the time we checked in with the greeter, to the time the salads were brought to our table. And this was on a Sunday night.  When the steaks arrived finally, one was over cooked (medium was well done), and my children's medium steak was raw (not rare, but raw). And they completely forgot their side orders. For the first time in my life, I sent food back. It was simply unsafe to eat. They shared my steak with me, because after waiting an hour-and-half, we couldn't possibly wait another 30 minutes for them to correct their mistake.  Javier, our waiter, was no where to be found for long periods of time. Twice we needed drink refills, and after waiting for long periods of time, I asked another waiter/waitress to kindly find him...  Although I spoke to the manager and he apologized, the damage was done. Never again will I subject my kids or myself to such poor, careless service again! Way to go ruining a birthday dinner, Texas Roadhouse! Thanks for nothing! I'll spend my money elsewhere.

-1ZWgrCi3dD7ppDb48B4Uw.text: I always get either beef tips of the chicken critters! It's soooo much food! The bread alone I am already satisfied. They have really good service and meals always come out hot. However there have been a few times where my boyfriend has complained about it not being fresh and he had to send back his plate but they are always very accommodating. Be prepared to wait for a table though

photos.caption: Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Tempe, AZ, United States. The bar area is nice!

uEe5r1vyTZG-dBxod3jeug.text: The wait staff is excellent! But, they must have different cooks on the weekend! During the week, steaks are cooked perfectly. The weekend, everything is overcooked: ribs burned, rare burger had burned edges and the potatoes were even dry!

ll9R2stC9DhXgXMNuEhfPg.text: Great atmosphere and a great deal for a ribeye steak!  I recommend to get a side of their buffalo sauce to complement the steak!

PrX07cBu8VPG5ol6Wa784g.text: Ive decided to give this place another try.  Received feedback from the owner and a complementary meal.  I took my time coming back, beause i was so unhappy with the previous service and food.  I must say, this time was AWESOME!!! My server was Kris, she was very attentive, polite and just great.  The food wasnt like licking a salt lick like my last experience. It was MLK day, so you opended later in the day.  There was a line, but it moved very fast and we were seated quickly.  Overall, it was a way better experience and i WILL be back.  Thank you!

p0OG85MSE5T19LRsyNsDdA.text: not so good for me,we ordered 2 vegetables for the sides, but they looks like totally different! That looks like cooked six hours ago!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Tempe, AZ, United States. You can see it without I saying anything!

uzvVv0AgkkN2VGmX2ad8sw.text: I was a little nervous to eat at Texas Roadhouse, because of the poor reviews about their service, but my fiance & I decided to give it a go anyways. We got there at 7:40pm on a Saturday & there was a 25-35 minute wait. Which wasn't a surprised since it was Saturday. There was a ton of people waiting & it made it a little awkward to find a spot that was not in anyone's way.  We waited about 30 minutes before we were seated. Our sever, Andrea (Drea on her name tag) was fantastic!! She made sure that everything was refilled before we were empty, which for me is a huge deal. She was very friendly & checked on our table regularly. I give Drea alone 5 stars!! I was pleased with my rib eye expect for the fact I ordered medium rare & it came out medium. I think the quality of food for your money is great!!  The only thing that was a little off putting was the loud music & every once in awhile the servers had to dance. It kinda felt like we were having dinner at a bar, which I didn't care for.

ASzAJrENz9nAeRUMsWc0Ew.text: Check order if you do takeout.  Missing some of our food and didn't want to drive all the way back to get it.

jIfsHiIWbJ_PbhUsrHKbTw.text: Come several times a month. Never fails us. We like sitting at the Bar (booths). Always same two waitresses They are Professionals. Fast. Friendly. Always checking.  Oh the food...... Roadhouse is Great on all. The 6oz is enough for me. Always perfectly done. Ribs have lots of meat. Get the loaded baked potato. Worth it. Salads always the freshest.  Lots of TVs in bar but not too loud. Just great place.

kkiwAeML2IvrYfg6_fhPYg.text: Honesty was pretty disappointed. I really wanted mac n cheese for one of my sides but didn't see it on the menu,  decided I would ask just in case and I was excited to know they actually did have Mac n cheese, it just wasn't in the menu. I ordered the New York steak with mashed potatoes and corn also. Everything was great until I got my mac n cheese only to realize it was just kraft mac n cheese. I wish they would have told me that before I was told I had to pay and additional   2+$ when I could have gotten my own box for .99! Not cool Texas road house.. not cool..

nwPdb7HJKWP14oWGsC08Bw.text: Really like texas road house very good food and the rolls are the best with the honey butter the food is just that good everu time i go to texas road house.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Tempe, AZ, United States. Fried steak

-PuuxSWVxd7SzatVw1M41Q.text: I was there with a group of six.  We all ordered different items and all felt the food was mediocre except for one member of our party that ordered a hamburger.  He commented that the burger tasted funny and left most of it uneaten.  He decided later to try another bite and found a piece of plastic in the burger.  Who knows what else was in it. The rolls were good.  The sides were decent.  The beer was cold.  That is the best I can say about  the experience.

NV_QGRKiiWzrnAF_GmCUng.text: First off, service for me will make or break an experience,  and Rachel made this one an excellent experience!  Super friendly,  helpful,  on top of things, and attentive without being intrusive.  As for the food, perfectly cooked and seasoned.  My Dallas filet was tender, flavorful and juicy.  Fries well seasoned.  Well worth the stop...and my Vikings were kicking the cardinals butts on tv, special for me.

Jc7clZDVfVzUDn5SZBWtrw.text: Service stinks, server got our food order wrong. Takes the chicken and "slides" it off the plate and it takes another 20 minutes to get the ribs we ordered. My friends steak came raw when it was ordered well done and the topping on the cake was we got over charged. Completely dissatisfied with this place!!!!

4ztA_bYYA1Al3yMYKiB89A.text: I have since visited this location twice after my initial review. I should mention I was contacted by the GM through a private message from my initial review. I accepted the offer to revisit this location in hopes they could earn my business again.  Both times it was my wife and I and we sat at the bar. Shanda the bartender was there both times and she was great! Tentative and made sure we enjoyed ourselves! Actually remembered us from the first visit. These two visits were a drastic improvement from before. Granted initially it was a group of 6 and this time 2 people. We will continue to go back until something further happens.

deWt0x-bXxiahgvt2zGZeg.text: I truly love everything about Texas Roadhouse! First off, I used the online check in for the first time and it was absolutely amazing! I showed up at the stated time and we were seated at our table 2 minutes after we walked in. And the house was packed! The average wait time was 60-90 minutes. The staffing NEVER disappoints. Everyone is extremely friendly. It did take a while for the waitress to greet us and then took even longer to get our bar order but I understand it was a Saturday night with a full house. And how can you be mad after all you are seated with a basket of the best fresh rolls in town! Our waitress was excellent! I explained to her that I knew the portions were big and that I was looking for a small portion, and she was able to come up with several options for me. Now that's service! The food was excellent and we all left happy and extremely full.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Tempe, AZ, United States

lKGIIWKS_nwifHtoou1wQQ.text: I went here last night with a few friends and had such a great experience. Our waitress, Krista, was super friendly and quick to service. The restaurant was super loud, as to be expected but it was great to feel welcomed.   We called ahead to make a reservation, and got there two minutes late but they still sat us down. Our food was great, well cooked and prepared.   Would recommend coming here at least once to experience it, there is something for everyone on the menu and the prices range which is nice for those like myself on a budget.

N4tA3E9nXgEPNPYX9Shh2g.text: This was my brother's choice for dinner while we were visiting Arizona! I've always wanted to try one and am so glad we did!!   We took a short drive to the restaurant had a short wait for a table. Our server was Jessie and she was very friendly and informative! We told her it was our first time here and she gave us a quick rundown of the menu.   Checking in on Yelp! offers a free appetizer and we got the blooming cactus blossom. It was a great presentation and we ate most of it.   We ended up getting some steaks and sides and really enjoyed our meals. On Wednesday's they have a sirloin special for $10.99 which was cool! My brother and I got ribeyes. The meat was cooked very well and so tender. My only small complaint is that my piece seemed a little heavy handed with the salt. My brother's piece was perfect!!   My favorite part about this place is their rolls!!! I don't even know what they put on them, but W O W. They come out hot and fresh along with a cinnamon butter!! It is seriously addicting!   We will probably be back to this franchise again! We had a great experience!   *if you have a sensitive peanut allergy, be cautious as there are peanut shells everywhere!*

photos.caption: Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Tempe, AZ, United States. 8oz ribeye
Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Tempe, AZ, United States. 10oz ribeye
Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Tempe, AZ, United States. They cut to order so if they don&#39;t have a portion you like, they will cut it for you!

llbKJ559XrjjdppA0dIymg.text: Stopped in after spending an eternity at IKEA. The previous reviews had my expectations low, but we were hungry. Our server was delightful! Super nice and on top of everything, really unexpected. Thanks Dillon. The beer... oh my goodness... the frosty cups! Why don't more establishments serve their beer this way?? Tasty. The main part of our meal was fine. Steak cooked well, great beer, yummy bread. The kids meal hotdog wasn't all that great. Dry dog and soggy fries. The toddler didn't care much, he picked out the good pieces. The side salad lettuce had some browning to it, and the mashed potatoes tasted sweet, didn't eat them, didn't return them. It was fine, who needs potatoes when you get pillowy warm bread!

dckG1Jdo5EqrFIgf8f_Yyg.text: Dem rolls tho! So bomb! Honestly that's what I think if Texas Roadhouse as the best thing there. When I went there recently I kept thinking of how good the rolls will be and the food is mediocre from past experience, but this time around it was actually a very good tasting dish.   I decided to order the smoothed chicken with a side of loaded mash potatoes and a caesar salad. The salad was a nice balanced salad with tasty coutons and the chicken tasted perfect all around with well cooked onions, mushrooms and cheese on top. Whatever they seasoned the chicken with it tasted awesome! Now the loaded mash potatoes we're just a great dish I could eat everyday. Nice smooth mash potatoes with a nice amount of cheese, bacon and sour cream. I felt like it was a little heavy handed on the sour cream but it was delicious.   Our server was pretty awesome and very attentive on  a very busy early evening. Kind of impressed this time around going to Texas Roadhouse and I do feel like I'll make another trip there soon!

MLBM1aH6qDXTDUBPf48v6g.text: When one goes to Texas Roadhouse, it's obviously for those delicious slick and buttery rolls with their addicting cinnamon butter. Aside from that, their food is no joke either. Texas was not kidding when their slogan's "Go big or go home," because BIG is definitely what we received from service to food to SMILES! All of my food came out probably no longer than 5 minutes, 10 minutes tops, and all of the food came out steaming hot! Our server was very attentive to our every need and always stopped by to make sure we were content with everything despite how busy it was the night we visited. Thank you so much for the wonderful service!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Tempe, AZ, United States

DApRp-yJMSI8LpLLGXUZcA.text: This is the 4th or 5th visit and every time they struggle with the sirloin, medium. Every time it is delivered well. Wait staff are responsive and engaging. I can tell you what they do well...the ribeye. Perfect every time.

LXkt27_1cj1oSmLmmWB9oQ.text: The service was wonderful. Jo our server was on top of everything and made sure we had everything we needed. The food was so delicious! The steak was cooked perfectly, the chili was nice on a "cooler" day in Arizona, the mashed potatoes were creamy and the ribs fell off the bone. It was worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Tempe, AZ, United States

oGRSHr8XhsQO9ehHzG97Dw.text: This chain restaurant has everything you need for a pleasant experience. As you enter there is a nice glace case that they display all of the steaks they have to order. At the tables they have "all you can eat peanuts" in buckets. Country music plays to enhance the ambience. Nice menus laminated and clean! You can order tri tip, ribeye, top sirloin, NY strip, bbq chicken,  pulled pork, hamburgers and sandwiches just to give you an idea. Consistent good service to top it all off  makes us keep coming back for more. Must try, Enjoy!

MPXk5ZpvceMQqQfoOW0exQ.text: The steak was just WOW  I loved everything about Texas Roadhouse ! The Ribs were also to die for ! & the butter & bread they give you in the beginning is just delicious Went in today & service was poor ... our server wasn't as attentive as the first male server we had . The food was not so great either . The rib eye was very tough to chew . We had food delivered that we didn't ask for & when I called the server to fix a kitchen mistake she took my plate back . Then about 7 min later comes back and asks if I want my plate redone ... OF COURSE I want it redone . You can't expect me to half eat because a mistake from the kitchen ...

photos.caption: Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Tempe, AZ, United States. Sangria Margarita

SaAw_A74pc04HoQHtSeQLQ.text: Best ribs in Arizona.  Went in to carry out 2 full slabs of their absolutely delicious tender meaty ribs, and got great friendly service from Meghan. She was patient & helpful as we decided on our sides. Meghan sets the standard very high for excellent customer service. She offered water while we waited for the order & then took each container out of the bag to be sure the order was correct. Definitely will go back & will recommend Texas Roadhouse to others. Thanks for an outstanding dinner.

MjEIjJdYkwGEuXA_Z8yvrA.text: I like coming to this place.  The service has always been great.  The food has been consistantly good too.  We got here early had to wait a few minutes.  While waiting put some Dwight Yoakam on the jukebox.  We ordered the steaks and they came with in a good time.  The flavour was great too.  The only thing is I think they gave us the wrong steak.  The steaks we got this time were thinner.  Normally they are a lot thicker cut. The sides were great too.  This place is a great value for the food you get.

6pxqqbSag4lQksAXOAuWGA.text: Went here tonight for some drinks after a teacher friend had a great experience giving his students a tour here. He said that during the tour staff went above and beyond to accommodate his students. Tonight we ate at the bar and the bartender Chris was on top of everything and just an awesome guy!

acKOEWHIHB9DMuJ9i57-ZQ.text: Loved the Texas Roadhouse at metro center when we lived in N Phoenix. Ordered takeout regularly and were always happy with it.  We moved to chandler in November and have done takeout twice at this location: First time we ordered two dinners...wife's shrimp was absolutely burnt. Tasted like rubber and she threw almost the entire dinner away. My medium rare steak was dry and borderline well done.  Tonight we ordered an app and 3 dinners: Blossom: basically a raw onion. It was cut on the outside and breaded but one large uncut and unbreaded center. Wife's sweet potato was totally blackened. Pure black marshmallows. Sister's chicken entree was missing cheese. My burger was missing all toppings and was overdone.  One time of mistakes is understandable...steaks can be overdone sometimes. But tonight's dinner was just complete lack of consideration with horribly obvious mistakes. I'll definitely look somewhere else next time.

_cgphQcQBPPIYEeHRoxAVw.text: I had the 6 oz sirloin, my wife the pork chip, both were very good. Great flavor. Baked potato very good, salad excellent. Everything great, but Chop, our waiter was outstanding! Friendly, professional, with a great smile, this young made the visit memorable!

wncpD0HA-b7m2rl0NXB_gw.text: DO NOT EAT AT THIS RESTAURANT! I ordered the filet mignon with loaded baked potato and green beans.  As soon as I got home was sick.  I went to the Emergency Room because the pain was so bad.  DO NOT EAT AT THIS RESTAURANT.  I am trying to prevent you from getting food poisoning!

GQ6oVLnbanA0IgoBAFo-vw.text: Still as good as it was 19 years ago when they opened near us. We skipped a few years due to many things but tonight we decided to go and we were not disappointed.  This is not a Ruths Cris steakhouse. It is a steakhouse for just us plain folks. Great service good food and just a fun place to spend with friends and family.   SHOUT OUT TO LEX. SHE MADE OUR EVENING WITH HER CARING PERSONALITY AND WONDERFUL SERVICE.. STAPLEY AND US60 LOCATION. ALSO TO CHRIS, THE MAN IN CHARGE.

HjuguqSl-ZC5T58wQBSucQ.text: My family and I ate here for my birth diner. We had a great time and the food was amazing. Our server, Chop, was so great and attentive. He made sure we had everything we needed and always cleared the empty plates quickly. My favorite place for a good family night.

GelcU2ZMf3WrKv-ZESlw6w.text: Great place I stop in at 11:45 and I was taken care fast with my family of 5. Not to crowded on Saturday morning. Food was amazing as always.

0In_OBN__6dElbR9YhlgmA.text: Can't go wrong with Texas Roadhouse.  I've been coming to Texas Roadhouse for about 6 years and I've never had a bad experience.  The service, food, and prices are all wonderful!  Some of my favorites are the country fried chicken, any of burgers, steaks: rib eye, prime rib and even the sirloin steaks are all delicious. It just depends on what cut of meat you want. The entree's usually come with two sides. I like the mashed potatoes with white gravy or the loaded sweet potatoes.    I can't forget to mention the complimentary buns with cinnamon spread while you are waiting for your food!   The sweet tea is always a winner here if you like sweet tea.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas Roadhouse - Tempe, AZ, United States. Rattlesnake bites

nAhH1HzOwlE9xFJvvgRRmA.text: The waitress was great but the food was not. My chicken was rubbery and poorly seasoned.  I just ate a few bites of the chicken which I ended up giving the leftover chicken to my parent's dog.

FvsRJq5TitU2ZhAo5ae6oQ.text: We've been here many times, but I forget to review it.  Food is pretty good,  crowded but steady seating- wait is short. You can do call ahead seating up to an hour ahead.  When you are seated,  it is with warm rolls and honey butter.   We were here tonight for a birthday dinner,  party of 8, including 3 kids.  Waiter was great. He was attentive,  checked in enough but not so much.  His name was David- definitely one of the nicest we've ever had there. Thanks!

-2XOVGaiF96Zd4Tw2eHcYQ.text: Okay so this is the story of when Applebees ran away to live in the Southwest... Except they seemed to have lost something on the way down. Granted, it's a Saturday afternoon during the lunch rush but it was the little things that just made it.... Meh.  When I walked into the restaurant I seemed to have broken the seating hostess; she just started at us until she realized she should seat us. Our waitress was nice enough when she finally showed up. We had to ask other servers for our silverware, straws, and the remaining parts of our meals. My glass was broken too... Found out the hard way.   Food was dry and boring. Don't order the green beans, for the love of god.

p_oWLWYbs8UgGMgtp144vQ.text: This is the WORST Texas Roadhouse I have ever been to. If I could give it a zero, I would.  I have been to Texas Roadhouse many times but at a different location.  We assumed that all are the same but this one is not.  We sat at the bar.  It was 8pm so they were not super busy. The ordered a drink that was not the normal standards.  I know this because we have ordered it many times at different locations.  We mention it to the bartender.  That is when things went south. We started noticing that the bartender was more attentive to others at the bar.  We waited for an hour for our food and we started noticing everyone who came in AFTER us started getting their food.  We ask a bus boy for a manager because can clearly see we have annoyed our bartender by calling her out on her drink. Then he tells the another bartender and all of a sudden  everyone is in a panic except our original bartender. She doesn't care.  Even though we sitting there so it's  not like she kept "missing" us.  It took 7 mins for a manager to even talk to us claiming they lost our ticket. At this point we wanted corporates number and everyone's name.  The manager said that well they are going to direct you back to us anyways like no one is going to care.  You can't give me my hour  back.  And they moved us like our opinion didn't matter. The managers didn't even want to give us the bartender's name.  It was like they were protecting her.  I called corporate and they said someone would call within 3 days. It took 8 days.  Then corporate called again saying we will be getting a call from the store manager.  GUESS WHAT..they did NOT!!! And it has been a month. Looks like they want to protect their people more than do what is right.  As we were leaving there was a gentleman at the bar and he heard our story.  He asked "do you think I shouldn't order because you guys didn't get your food?" We said " I am sure you will.  You aren't a minority." Thanks James Biel, the owner of that store, for not even a call.

RmGtxDASeAnQodVM80LTGg.text: I usually enjoy going to Texas Roadhouse and I've been to several in different cities but this one had the worst service of any I've ever visited.  We were in Tempe for a little mini vacation this last weekend and before we headed home we stopped in at this location figuring it was a safe and good bet. We were seated by a hostess who offered us appetizers but then wasn't interested in answering any questions. She seemed to be in a rush to go back to hanging out by the front door and told us our server would be with us shortly. We were left with cool rolls that had clearly been sitting for a while.  20 minutes later no one had stopped by our table and we felt we had waited long enough so we complained to a different hostess who was manning the hostess station. Apparently our first hostess had sat us at a table that wasn't being served at the time but she indicated that they'd be happy to seat us correctly at that point. Since we had to get on the road and we had seen the staff goofing off and not really having an interest in paying much attention to customers while we were waiting we declined and asked to make a complaint to the manager.   We were told that the manager wasn't available and all we could do was walk out and stop at a random drive through to grab a quick burger as we headed out of town.   All things considered we won't be stopping by at this Texas Roadhouse if we're ever in town again. It was a really disappointment and I would strongly recommend against stopping by this place. They had extremely poor service and really don't live up to the Texas Roadhouse name.

DWaNr2YsW2CmSKKE5035qg.text: Alright even though I'm leaving the restaurant and have to listen to Nicki Minaj I will say the dinner this evening was pleasant. We had to wait 10 to 15 minutes for a table but it wasn't so bad.  We went up to the bar and had a couple margarita, that seems to make things a lot more tolerable. Tara was our server tonight and I think she was awesome. Once again it could have been based on the influence of a margarita, it was a good margarita, but with an additional shot of  tequila how could it be bad?!  Anyway, I wasn't especially hungry and ate less than half of my entree. Thought it tasted pretty good, delivery of the entree was within a reasonable period of time, Tara was consistent and checking in with us just see if everything was okay -bringing water if we needed it, ordering up another cocktail if we wanted one and offered to bring more bread if we wanted it ( oh my God, no more bread ). Meals were tasty, enough to share and all was satisfying. I can suggest you start with a couple margs while you nosh on the peanuts and just hope real hard Tara is your server. Another option, ask for Tara.

RSv0rCHuCrWTNQrg-7A3ZQ.text: I have zero complaints.  The service is always fast and friendly. The atmosphere is cool and laid back and their steaks are ohhh so delicious! This is our favorite steak spot. We just try nor to get so full off of their hot rolls and sweet butter

oPVAk5FWR5ZoNLAF00mkvA.text: I love this place! Not only is the staff always friendly and kind, but the food is always great. Fast service, and awesome atmosphere.

sAULvap8yu8ANLXNuFmlMA.text: For ambience this place is good.   For food quality it gets only 3 stars.    I had the small filet and if there was any seasoning on it I could not detect any.  Good steaks can be found at The Keg or Firebirds.  My mate had a chicken salad which was decent.  However, one expects a place with "Texas" in the name to have outstanding steaks.  Warning: If you have any peanut allergies stay far away.  There are buckets of peanuts on every table.   Fortunately, there is a small notice posted at the door about this.  By the way, we called for reservations and the hostess said that they do not take any.  She said that we can call to see how long the wait time is.

zLo64YzmF7rUfL7mBkx-Tg.text: Came here after Spring Training. The line to be seated was quite long but for a party of two it took about 20mins. Service was great, our server was very nice. Our server brought us piping hot dinner rolls with cinnamon butter.... they are addicting! We ordered the 8oz Sirloin and Rib plate which comes with two sides (we did Ceaser salad and loaded mash potatoes; both were very tasty). We requested the steak Medium and were not disappointed, it was flavorful and juicy, possibly one of the most flavorful steaks I've had from a chain steak house. The ribs were ok, I prefer juicy ribs, these came out a bit burned and dry but our server quickly replaced them when we brought it to her attention. The second time around they were as advertised "falling off the bone" and tasty. The drink we were recommended was the Jamaican Cowboy Margarita and it was Amaze! I hate super sweet syrupy margaritas and this one with a salted rim was perfect. I think we'll make this part of our yearly AZ Spring training tradition.

G62_J7nb84LHUNDePCWq9w.text: This place was the worst steakhouse I've ever been too. We are currently sitting down writing this review while EVERY WAITER/WAITRESS walks by both of us asking not one asked us if we had even wanted water. I've already asked to move once to the bar and they had said it was not open seating. Yet still no service, place blows I would rather eat at Pizza Hut.

Qqy2h5cGKia3FN9EvWhDrQ.text: They have the best rolls in the world.. chicken critters are amazing along with the staff

s47_8HPeBH388lC4PDuZAw.text: Been to this location 4-5 times, and always mediocre at best. Overpriced and small cocktails (at least mine). Great service tho!  Last trip, ordered 10oz Prime Rib, med rare w/ ribs. Peanuts, ok they're free (oh wow!) but staler than sh*t. Ribs, dry and pretty tasteless. Prime Rib - AWFUL!!!  The outside 1/4" was burnt and hard, couldn't eat.  The body of the steak was a kind of rubbery rare.  Like they cook it sous-vide to serve it.  Definitely wasn't a slow cooked prime rib!  For sure not cooked to order. Ate less than half and gave up.  Brought left overs home thinking for a stir-fry, but i'll just toss it.  lol, best part was the corn & bread.  Used to be a semi-regular at the Mesa location a few years back. Don't know if the location or most likely the economy (& cutting corners) is at fault.... but I've had my fill unfortunately.   Definitely rather spend a few bucks more and go to Long Horn Steakhouse.  Absolutely mouth watering prime rib & steaks.

UW2Xom1sMQxPYmRogTXLjA.text: Lived in AZ for over a year.  Hands down best service I've had since I moved here.  Shanda at the bar was awesome! Can't go wrong with the ribs.  Come in small parties to avoid the wait.  I also love a place I can put peanut shells on the floor

q2F5d_pACffaHXBJn0_MZw.text: This was a "never again" experience.  We needed to go to Ikea so stopped in for lunch.  We can't even finish shopping because the salads in the car will spoil.  Cold, salty food,  limp fries and salads after entrees.  Just a "really?"  with no attempt to address our concerns.  No thank you I'll pass.

v9O81FMagUIl9j0R6N6vHw.text: Wow. We came here because it's usually a guaranteed decent food, full tummy, and good service. That sure as heck backfired and I never heard the end of it.   We are seated quickly, and started out ok. Stingy on the butter. Ordered food and  waited. And waited. Iced teas were super watery... Which is sad because normally their tea is great. It makes me prediabetic, but it's delicious. They ran out of rolls....Which I'm sorry is like red lobster running out of cheddar bay biscuits. At that point you should closer your doors or offer a discount.   food was  suuuuuuper slow. The order before us I think went back and forth several times with errors our changes our missing items. Yay.  My fillet medallions were cold. Not lukewarm, cold. Rice was not the same as usual either, lacking somehow. Was almost done eating by the time my sweet potato finally arrived, which at least that was hot.   Everyone else was on the same boat. The kids steak bites were mostly that middle piece out of the steak you leave in because if you cut around it you will destroy the steak, but you really don't want it in there because it's unpleasant to chew into. Yeah so must of her steak bites were just stringy tendon y inedibles. Yum.   Overall it was not a great experience. We did get a five dollar discount for my potato, which is better than nothing. I am sure it was just a bad day, but come on. I'm as loyalty member...I'm.a patron.you can do better.

eiX8X6G1nfTtkURRKhLNHA.text: Love Texas Road House. I've been to several across the US and the steaks are excellent and the service is great.

Ai9OkxaTs_RQIElcolE92A.text: Tempe location.  Service was painfully slow waiting 30 minutes to just get a drink.  Started with dirty app plates being delivered to our table.  Food was fine, but several mistakes in the order that they had to keep correcting.  Three hours for dinner at 6 pm with a seating call ahead on a Saturday - beware.  My first time there and not worth going back.

nAb7wbrT_261zPnU5MrpPQ.text: Great place for family and larger seating requirements.  The steaks are great and our kids loved the kids menu.

LAmZYqabaYVg2Zq6TrtRNA.text: Been here a few times and typically have had a good experience. I'd say, it's been awhile since I've felt like an inconvenience to a business that's taking MY money like I had this previous visit to TRH. From my water to my 12oz steak (or 6oz of steak, 6oz fat), and my mini, over-cooked sweet potato. Or the plethora of different drinks we DIDN'T order in place of the drinks we DID order. Two stars for the ice doing well keeping my water  cold.   I think we'll continue extending the time between visits to this TRH and consider better options just down the street on Ray Rd.

u1BH01U0OojFOowIVT7NEg.text: This place never disappoints!!! They have reasonable prices and great steaks! The place is very casual and country. While you're waiting, you can snack on some dried peanuts and throw the shells on the floor, which entertained my 5 year old by stomping on the shells!!! The ambiance is definitely not for "first-date" type...or maybe it is?! It is somewhat loud but not too loud that you guys need to yell at each other. They have the best dinner rolls, fresh, warm and soft. The steaks are ALL amazing and well seasoned...there's no wrong choice here. Service is awesome! Our server, Natasha, is the best!!! She was mindful of our drinks and often checks on us if we need anything else. We also got a free appetizer if you check in at Yelp. Just present the coupon to the server.  Overall, I definitely would recommend this place to everyone. Every time we visit our cousins in Arizona, we ALWAYS have to come here.

Wy5rdQH3dN3h3FT_qfpwNQ.text: We were wanting some BBQ chicken/ribs for lunch so we decided to check out this place.  I had the herb crusted chicken and my partner had the BBQ ribs.  The chicken was juicy and flavorful but I'm not sure I would call it 'herb crusted.' I would say it's a marinated chicken breast.  The steamed vegetables that were on the side were very disappointing- they were frozen and not fresh which is not a big deal but they came out mushy.  My partner's ribs were ok but not fall off the bone.  On a positive note, the margarita I had was good.    It wasn't terrible but I wouldn't go back.  On a side note they do not offer dark meat chicken.

jg8pfK6gr3BLyBOCGMPjrQ.text: This Roadhouse might be missing a Swayze but hey it isn't quite as rowdy as The Double Deuce.   I'll admit we came here because we were feeling like cheapskates and wanted to partake in the discounted Early Diner meals (M-F 3:30 to 5:30) where a selected number of items are $9.99 with 2 sides. Not a bad deal! The items vary from steak, chicken, pork or salad. I opted for the 6 oz sirloin with fresh vegetables and green beans. While we waited there was some tasty, pillowy freshly baked bread brought to our table along with some sweet cinnamon butter. There's also a bucket of salted peanuts in shell for those that want a more low carb snack to nosh on while the main entrees arrive.   The 6 oz sirloin with sides wasn't much presentation wise, but it tasted alright, about as much as you would expect for discounted steak lol. I requested it medium and it came out about medium well instead. Despite this being a Texas Roadhouse, it was a non-Texan, smallish portion of steak (It is only 6 oz after all) but was well seasoned at least. The sides were decent. The fresh vegetables consisted of steamed broccoli and carrots, and the green beans were steeped in a smokey bacony broth.   Service was excellent here. Our server was really on top of things about refilling drinks and taking away plates.

rKZXGU9hEgnCUGihH7vI6Q.text: Service is awesome amazing when we come to this located we are never disappointed. Whitney was an amazing server she was always on top of things and made sure we had everything we needed and our food was the way we wanted it. I definitively recommend her to a server to any one that goes eat here.

Y_564ZYoAcQUOeg-0mB49A.text: The restaurant is fun vibrant, they have amazing salads, and their steak is awesome The free peanuts are great, the restaurant is a little noisy, but I guess that's why it's so good

uc4W4dgBkdcv7iRYFW5HiA.text: If I could give zero stars, I would.  Arrived and questioned wait time for a party of four. Since 2 guest were not present with us, they would not give us an estimated wait time.  The hostess was completely obtuse.  I have seen 5 year olds with lemonade stands have greater knowledge and more integrity.  Avoid this place at all costs.  Completely dismissive. I understand the business aspect but could a hostess show some respect?  We ent to a business a couple doors down and had a wonderful experience.

MvHHOLqp6tPGhhuzeWAiRQ.text: So let me start by saying I like Texas Roadhouse's food. But this location twice has failed. 1st time was 2 years ago and the food was subpar to the Texas roadhouses I'm use too. 2nd time which was today, we called for a phone check in. The hostess stated the wait was about 15 minutes. We got there in 10 minutes and heard my wife's name being called "Karen party of 5" we said that was us. Another hostess who was on the phone said that isn't us, it's another group. But that group was a party of 4? So the hostess on the phone said I ain't even check you guys in yet. Then proceeds to give us a fab and tells us it's a 30 min wait. Like what the hell!!!! Over the phone they gave us a confirmation number. The hostess never even listened to what my wife was saying and never got a chance to give the number. I hate to give poor reviews but I was extremely upset with the way the hostess handled us. What's the point of checking in over the phone!!!!!!! Needless to say we took our party of five to Outback!!!!!

ggN4e4jeNzJI0kTt5sPImQ.text: The food was simply amazing. The taste of the stakes made us feel like if we were in Texas. Shelby made of an ordinary dinner an incredible experience. Thank you for first class customer service, Shelby!

bMHo1cisB75EJco_n5PVDA.text: I will say the salad itself is a 5 star chicken caesar. The bread is also 4 star, but I couldn't have any on Keto.   ):  I would not have come here, but some friends wanted to take me to dinner for my birthday, and this is where they took me.  I'm glad they did-because I have a NEW favorite place for the BEST chicken caesar salad I've had.  I wasn't expecting that.  It's crowded, and you may have to wait to be seated, and it's noisy, and kids are running all around (ugh). BUT I have braved all of this - twice more- JUST to have this crispy, delicious (yum yum dressing) PERFECT tender chicken salad!  If you are a checked caesar fan-come try it out.

5-UFp009eazoXseSNPLliA.text: We had a great time until close to the end when my toddler started to cry because of the TV behind us was showing very detailed gory photos of dead bodies and crime scenes. They should really check the channels throughout the day, bloody dead mangled bodies and eating don't mix.
